overview_of_class: This course covers the development of spoken and written language as it relates to child development, including phonological, morphological, syntactic, semantic and pragmatic components. Cultural and individual linguistic diversity is also a focus. The course is conducted completely online. It will be asynchronous; students can participate in discussions and complete assignments by working at their own pace, as long as deadlines are met. A technology fee will be added to tuition.
name: Language Development Usage
title: SCS CSD 392-DL-12 Language Development Usage

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers the development of spoken and written language as it relates to child development, including phonological, morphological, syntactic, semantic and pragmatic components. Cultural and individual linguistic diversity is also a focus. The course is conducted completely online. It will be asynchronous; students can participate in discussions and complete assignments by working at their own pace, as long as deadlines are met. A technology fee will be added to tuition.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: This course is restricted to students in the Prespeech Pathology program. Other SPS students may register using a permission number, if room is available. Please email kate-schultz@northwestern.edu for more information.

subject: CSD
